sn35.62:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the principle for depleting all fuel.
sn35.62:4.3: And what is the principle for depleting all fuel?
sn35.62:5.1: What do you think, mendicants? Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:7.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.62:9.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.62:9.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.62:15.1: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:17.9: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.62:19.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.62:21.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.62:21.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.62:23.1: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.
sn35.62:23.2: And they become disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.62:23.3: They become disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.62:23.4: They become disillusioned with the mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and mind contact.
sn35.62:23.5: And they become disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
sn35.62:23.8: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.62:23.9: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn35.62:23.10: This is the principle for depleting all fuel.”
